website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a fun game that introduces youngsters to the fundamentals of Monopoly, this is the one to get.
pros: Combines eye-catching graphics and easier rules that make it fun for kids to play – suited for ages 5 to 8
Properties geared to kids, like a skate park and ice cream parlor
cons: Quite remedial compared to the classic version – some kids may find it boring once they master it

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - Missing Significant Pieces
customer_reviews.text: My grandson and I were super excited for this game to arrive and play it only to find it was missing the package of "sold" signs. Hard to play it the right way without being able to tell which properties are available and sold. Try to explain that to a 5 year old that insisted on trying to play it anyway. Not sure how this could happen since the game had obviously not been opened previously and was completely wrapped in plastic. Considering it has all been opened before realizing this, I'm unable to return it.
customer_reviews.author: princesstracyd

customer_reviews.title: Great Family Game
customer_reviews.text: This arrived on Sunday and now, by Tuesday, we have played at least half a dozen rounds of Monopoly Junior. The rules are simple; my almost 5 year old can play. My 7 year old mastered it quickly. The games are pretty quick. One of the rules is that when you land on an un-owned property that you must buy it; we changed that to be optional so there are more choices to make. We're very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Beginner Version
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginning version of Monopoly. My six year loves regular Monopoly, but it's a little too long and complex sometimes for her. This was a great solution. Instructions are easy to understand even for my six and three year old. The four characters are cute and perfect for kids. I do think the dice should be a littler bigger. They can be a choking hazard being smaller then standard dice. I also wish they had one other type of money then just one dollar bills. Like a five or ten would be nice. Overall my kids love this game and have blast playing it. Read the rules because it's different then regular Monopoly.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: My 6 year old daughter LOVED monopoly. We only had the adult version but ...
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old daughter LOVED monopoly. We only had the adult version but she still insisted on played so we had to come up with all sorts of shortcuts and tricks to be able to just get through the game with her. So for her 7th Birthday, I got this kids version of the game for her. She loves it! It's perfect for her at this age and she is able to understand how to play with the help of an adult. It was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: 7 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old grandson loves to play this game, and it is so similar to the adult version that we don't mind playing it with him either. It is basically a simplified version of regular Monopoly, using less money and more "streamlined" rules that kids can easily follow. I can see him graduating to the regular version very soon, which I find to be one of the best games around to prepare one for life in this world. The only reason I knocked off one star was because the quality, unfortunately, is not that great.
customer_reviews.author: Victory

customer_reviews.title: Not same as the photo
customer_reviews.text: Fun game for the kids. Am disappointed that I got the version with new tokens. My son loves cats so I was hoping for the one in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Buckler

customer_reviews.title: Gameboard is not the one in the picture. But the game is great
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is that the gameboard is not the one in the picture. The items are different. My son want this one because it has a boat and a car and I receive the one with a penguin, duck, dinosaur and a dog. Amazon replace the item but I receive again the same board. I talked with my son and he understood. But was a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlog Del Fresno

customer_reviews.title: I like to play games with my kids and we do ...
customer_reviews.text: They must have redesigned the Monopoly Jr. game in the last few years. This game is very, very short to play. Essentially everything is one price. Buy a property pay 1 M$, Stay at that property, pay 1 M$. The prices go up to 3 M$ to buy and rent. I think the first game we played with 4 players lasted 5 minutes. The second might have gone for 7 minutes. I like to play games with my kids and we do quite a bit, but this one was just lacking any mental or strategic aspect. It's just roll the dice and move, roll the dice and move, and so on.
customer_reviews.author: North

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value perfect gift definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my grandson who will be seven soon he asked for monopoly and this will be perfect for us to play the figures are adorable with a penguin toy Ducky miniature Scotty and a little t Rex This is his Christmas present or one of them he’s going to love it and I’m sure will get many great play dates out of it
customer_reviews.author: mrshryan1215

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves this game!
customer_reviews.text: This game has changed from the original game I still have from when my children were young, but the changes make it easier for a 5 year old. It only has one dollar bills which I like! But, flat circles with the animal head that corresponds with each players animal, for their ownership of properties, I liked the plastic buildings better, they would stay in place on the board easier!
customer_reviews.author: numbers4u

customer_reviews.title: Great, QUICK Version of Monopoly to hold child's interest.
customer_reviews.text: My 5-year-old grandson loves this version of Monopoly. His mother wanted this for him, b/c he was getting bored over the summer. He really enjoys it, and I have to say, I enjoy playing Monopoly with him as well, because it doesn't take very long to complete a game. If you like Monopoly, but never play because you don't have enough time to commit to a game, then try this Junior version, especially if you want to spend some quality time with your kids. My 5-year old grandson sat and played 2 games with me, and it took about 30 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: love/hate relationship with this game
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves this game. The rules are easy to learn. You don't need to read. Yes, the pieces are kind of cheap as the other reviews mention, but you have plenty of pieces in the box if one breaks. I hate this game as an adult though, it is ridiculously based on luck (much more than any other child's game) and on who gets to go first.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Classic game, really fun
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gift for a holiday give away for youth who have lost a parent due to gun violence. Our church filled up a large box with gifts of this nature. There was a party where the gifts were given out. Although I could not attend, I hope some one is playing Monopoly and hoping it takes their mind off of the tragedy that has happened..... ...if only for a little while.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: This one is PERFECT for her
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old daughter has been wanting to play monopoly but all the other monopolys are too hard for her. This one is PERFECT for her. Its very easy for her to understand how to play, it only has $1 dollar bills so its easier to count the money out.
customer_reviews.author: EVW5280

customer_reviews.title: Great for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased the game, I was wondering if it wouldn't be engaging enough for my 8 yr. old, but he loves it just as much as my other two children, who are 5 and 7.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Walta

customer_reviews.title: Good short game for 6 year old
customer_reviews.text: The game is a very simple version of Monopoly, if you land on a spot you must buy it, the rent it equal to the cost of the property, the money is all ones. It will be easy to add rules from the adult version as she gets older, but this is just right for my 6 year old now, and adults like playing it too! the game is really short to play less than 30 min.
customer_reviews.author: Leanna

customer_reviews.title: Great starter Monopoly game.
customer_reviews.text: Son loves this game. It took about an hour to play 2 person game. 6 yr old is ready for harder version after 2 plays. It's great but a 6 yr old and up might need the original game or a step up with more difficulty due to the ease of this game. I would suggest this for up to 5 years old but would recommend it to any Gr cuz it's still fun and keeps the basic concept of Monopoly.
customer_reviews.author: KarmaX

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it - relatively fast game
customer_reviews.text: Its a simplified version of monopoly.The 5 and 7 year old kids love it. Its takes about 15-20 minutes to get through a game. The Chips used for property ownership are just little pieces of cardboard. Already lost some. Cheapens the experience. Have you ever noticed how hard it is to use the paper money. its always sticking together when you are trying to peel it apart and its always moving everywhere when you want it to stay still....
customer_reviews.author: Airsick Lowlander

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it but
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old kid loves playing with this but as an adult I find it a bit too simple. May be that is why it is for kids. You only have $1 bills and buying, selling and renting is also $1. There is no big complication in the way you buy and sell. I would highly recommend for smaller kids. 5 year olds can definitely play a level higher but that is just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: CSgirl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect intro to Monopoly
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my kids for Christmas and they absolutely love it! A single game doesn't take too long (unlike regular Monopoly) and the system for purchasing and rent is very simplified so even my six-year-old caught on within minutes. There is a maximum of four players. Great gift for the whole family.
customer_reviews.author: JWil

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to play for a 5 yr old
customer_reviews.text: My 5 yo grandson had been begging to play all the “grown up” board games but those games were still a bit beyond him. Monopoly Jr has satisfied his requirement for a grown up board game and the adults enjoy playing also. Also purchased Clue Jr and that is a decent junior game as well. Monopoly Jr game itself is well made, not flimsy as so many of the classic games seem to be now a days.
customer_reviews.author: kimberjmb

customer_reviews.title: Great game, lousy packaging
customer_reviews.text: Although the game itself is super cute and lots of fun for a wide range of ages, I was very disappointed with the packaging. Its a huge box for a pretty small game (read: takes up too much space for what its worth space wise) and still theres no place inside the box to store money or cards neatly! Had to use ziplock bags and while playing the game pieces were all over. Id rather it be smaller box, but to be big AND not functional is a real oversight.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: My 5 year old daughter loves this game!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old daughter absolutely loves this game! She asks to play it almost every day, it's a little bit addictive, haha! I like that it's a modified version, it's definitely simplified for the kids, but they get to practice counting, recognizing numbers, following the rules, practicing their social skills, including a skill to learn how to win and how to lose (not to be a sour looser!). Highly recommend to every family out there! It's a fun game!
customer_reviews.author: Yulia W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Board Game in Junior Format
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect introduction to Monopoly. Play time is about 20 minutes, it is a fast-paced game. You could change the rules of the game a bit, to allow for longer play (like selling your property back to the bank if you go bankrupt). Most times our kids want to keep playing if someone goes bankrupt - they like the game that much. Although the game does allow for strategizing with certain chance cards, it is mostly due to luck that someone wins.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: 7 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We gave my daughter this game for Christmas. She's 7 years old and we have played it probably 3 times a day since Christmas. She loves board and card games and had really enjoyed playing! I'm grateful that it's not like regular Monopoly and only takes about 15-20 mins to play!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaplch

customer_reviews.title: A fun classic with the younger kids
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. The only thing we would complain about is that the properties are the same price to buy as they are to 'rent'. When you land on the space, you pay the same amount that the owner did! Also, it only has enough pieces for 4, and we have a family of 5, so I created an additional character and cards for the 5th character.
customer_reviews.author: Albie

customer_reviews.title: Fun family time
customer_reviews.text: We have two children in kindergarten and they love board games. This version of Monopoly is great for their age level. The rules are simple enough for them to follow and they even get a little practice counting the money and adding up how much they owe. We can actually finish a game in about 30 minutes, unlike regular Monopoly. The game pieces are cute too—just a little bonus.
customer_reviews.author: J. West

customer_reviews.title: Fun Family Game Night
customer_reviews.text: Our family is enjoying this game very much. It's easy for the little guy to get to know how to play the game and win. The game goes quickly with two or three people. Fun little game pieces and description cards to match each piece. The paper money is a little bit thin and hard to divvy out to everyone but otherwise for the cost and value of the game. It is just fine!
customer_reviews.author: NYSweetMom

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic first monopoly game for little ones
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic family game. Was extremely easy for my 7 year old boy and 5 year old girl to learn and play. This is perfect monopoly game for little ones. We have so much playing. The beta part is that the game is pretty quick and kids don’t get bored. Great find!!
customer_reviews.author: Varley

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for families! Teaches strategy and money principles. Even adults enjoy it.
customer_reviews.text: This game is so fun for my 5YO and 7YO children. We play as a family and they have learned a lot of strategy about the power of monopolies, the value of certain properties over others, and of course it's great practice for counting money. This game keeps the interest of adults too. Highly recommend! I much prefer to play this game over Candyland. =) Monopoly was a favorite of mine growing up. This Junior version does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: AmyF

customer_reviews.title: Soon we will upgrade to Monopoly but this is a great game for kids to learn to wait their turn
customer_reviews.text: My daughter recently turned 4 and she loves to play Monopoly Jr with the kids next door, ages 7 and almost 9. Soon we will upgrade to Monopoly but this is a great game for kids to learn to wait their turn, roll the die (yes just one), walk the requisite number of spaces, buy property or pay up, handle money, and handle winning or losing. I can even let one of the older children be banker because all the money is $1 bills.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Berry

customer_reviews.title: Game is easy and fun to play
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter was able to go shopping on Amazon and picked this game. I was not sure if it would be something she could understand, being she is 4. We had a fun time, no problem, very easy to play.
customer_reviews.author: jacquelyn h.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Working On Numbers
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite educational tools. We bought this right as the covid-19 pandemic started to surge and it has been great for engaging my 4 yr old. This game allows us to work on our counting, reading, and understanding of rules. It is great for learning without the formal feel of learning.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: If you were looking for monopoly Jr from the 90's, this is NOT it. It is super dumbed down, and I think suitable for any child that can count up to 6. My 5 and 7 year old were bored with it immediately, and I was very unwilling to play b/c of how they revised (dumbed down) the game... AWFUL.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gay

customer_reviews.title: A Simplified Monopoly Game for Young Children and Families
customer_reviews.text: Young children have short attention spans. Young children do not like the restraints put on them by regular Monopoly. This is a SIMPLIFIED version with the game ending when the first person runs out of money, then everyone else counts their $1 bills and the one with the most wins. You don't need to trade for properties, although you do buy them. My family loves board games and this one definitely allows a small child an introduction to them. It is a good way to teach your little ones that sometimes you do lose, sometimes you win. The four tokens are larger and cute.
customer_reviews.author: GrandpaJack

customer_reviews.title: Fun Kids Game
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying as an adult I am NOT a monopoly fan, but I do love playing this with my kids. Its a lot easier and generally faster than a regular game of monopoly. The kids have fun with it too so everyone is winning...and little do they know they are working on counting, finances, and overall math/life skills LOL
customer_reviews.author: jicole24

customer_reviews.title: Great board game in this quarantine!
customer_reviews.text: Brought this game for my 4 year old so I could introduce her to the mononopoly game in a more age-appropriate way. She loves it! While it takes a few games for all the concepts to sink in, she enjoyed playing the game and gets very competitive (in a good way)!
customer_reviews.author: carolyf

customer_reviews.title: Not what was advertised
customer_reviews.text: The game I ordered and the game I received are different games. I assume the rules are the same, but not the tokens I wanted or expected. False advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for kids!
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for a six yea rd old DC. I was worried that if would be too easy for her. There are suggestions that make the game more challenging. She loves to buy the expensive properties, and has had fun being the banker.
customer_reviews.author: JustJill

customer_reviews.title: Fun for adults  AND children
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good game for my 6 year-old granddaughter and struck gold with this game. It is probably more fun than the adult version. For of us played the game and we actually made up some "adult" rules like selling our properties and making loans. We had a blast and our 6 year-old loved it. We probably played the game 5 times over a long weekend. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen McNicholas

customer_reviews.title: Monopoly Junior is a Hit!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to have some games for when our nephews visit and this one is a hit. We like that it usually ends quicker then regular monopoly and also the lessens in counting and reading that it provides. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Hugger

customer_reviews.title: Cute Game!
customer_reviews.text: My son (age 4) has this game and loves it, so we bought a second one for my niece (age 6). Its a great kid. A little help is needed from parents, but its honestly a game I don't mind playing with them on a regular basis. Hours of family fun with this one!
customer_reviews.author: cdderrick

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 and 4 year olds and I love to play this game together. Easy for them to learn, the pieces are cute. Definitely not the same Monopoly JR I had in the 90's, but fun nin the less and enjoyable for our whole family of 4 to play together.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Santa

customer_reviews.title: Too simple
customer_reviews.text: Basic basic basic. To me this game is for ages 3 to maybe 5. Its all one dollar bills and way too simplified from the original version. It should have 5 and 10 dollar bills and the ability to buy more property among other things. I started my eight and 6 yo on Monopoly after one play of Monpoly Jr and they learned after 2x playing. I’d recommend buying Monopoly and teaching them to better bargin and count money. Don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great way to include the newest generation
customer_reviews.text: This was the Thanksgiving hit and allowed our 5 year old grandson to join in on the traditional family after meal game. This was a big hit with him and a bigger hit with me, the game took less than an hour and allowed for a serious nap before the Black Friday shopping. The game has been simplified, but kept the spirit and fun from thee full blown game, to be a great way to include the younger members and keep those 8 hour Monopoly marathoner's entertained.
customer_reviews.author: GrayTiger

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Traditional monopoly can drag on forever, leaving its players drained and begging for it to just end. This version is much faster and perfect for younger players. The rules are simplified and easy to understand. Our 6 yr old loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Monopoly Jr. Board Game
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my middle grandson's birthday. It has been a huge hit with all three boys and even more so since the present COVID-19 quarantine began. Fast delivery too. I would recommend this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: fla_girl

customer_reviews.title: Our son loves this game
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to a 6yr old for his birthday, and he loves the game! I thought he would like to experience money, and playing a more advanced board game. Usually he wins, but not because my wife, and I let him. Great game, and good family time!
customer_reviews.author: D. Grim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game for 6 year old girl
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 6 year old, she loves board games but finding one for around her age range that is also fun for adults is a challenge.. This was awesome, I look forward to playing. It’s simple enough so she understands but still fun. Only issue is she keeps winning and I’m really trying my best lol.
customer_reviews.author: Heyystacy

customer_reviews.title: 4 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 year olds birthday present and he loves it! He wasn’t sure about sitting down and playing a board game at first but he asks to play this every day now! I have always loved monopoly so I am glad I can share the jr version with my little one!
customer_reviews.author: AlyssaJ

customer_reviews.title: Boys love this game
customer_reviews.text: The boys love this game, when they win they like to count their money and spread it all over the place. It is great for 5 years old and up. Easy to understand and explain to them the rules. Great fun times for the family!
customer_reviews.author: Tsafrir

customer_reviews.title: No money, no costumer service
customer_reviews.text: Didn't ship with the monopoly money. Called customer service, they finally picked up after th 19th attempt. They said sorry. Not a big deal to use homemade money, but I shouldn't have to use homemade money when the discription clearly states it contains it.
customer_reviews.author: A.G.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend to buy
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old niece loved the game, it's her first time playing and she learnt quite quickly. The goal of the game is similar to original but more children friendly. Would have given it five stars but plastic parts a bit cheap and board could be more durable. Prefer the original material which I myself have had for ages. But at the discounted price I got and fun with my niece, it's definitely worth the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Adam

customer_reviews.title: Game is too Silly
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a fun game to play with my grandchildren. However, this is not the game at all. It's too silly and awkward even for young ones. Try an find the original Monopoly Jr game.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality materials
customer_reviews.text: Not at all the same Monopoly Jr as back in the day. No houses to put on the spaces, just cheap cardboard chips. Only $1 bills Chance cards and money are very thin. Everything about this set is cheap. :(
customer_reviews.author: ScienceRules

customer_reviews.title: 9-year-old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to play with my 9-year-old granddaughter. She loves Monopoly, but the regular game takes too long. Sometimes we are able to play this game 3 times in an afternoon. Highly recommend this for busy families that like Monopoly, but don't have hours to play.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma7

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: Game is great! so easy to play. Keeps concept of adult game while making play simple and easy. Kids learn while playing. Enjoyed this so much, bought copies as gifts for relatives and friends. Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Lee M.

customer_reviews.title: Just as pictured - cat, dog, car, boat
customer_reviews.text: Since some buyers have received other versions - wanted to share that on 9/30/2019 I received the version pictured with the cat/dog/car/boat and all the pieces seemed to be in great condition.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Great first Monopoly game for the younger kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a favorite in our family and played weekly. Our 3rd grade son could probably play the regular Monopoly game at this point, but not our 1st grade son just yet. This game was the perfect introduction to Monopoly and its concepts of purchasing properties, collecting rent, exchange of money, etc. from the original game but in a more simplified version. The game play is also significantly shorter and perfect for the shorter attention span of the younger elementary school crowd. Game board and playing pieces are very good quality and not cheap feeling. We're very happy with the purchase and highly recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie and Chris

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement over original MJr
customer_reviews.text: We like this modern version of the game- it has only $1 denomination and all properties are worth from $1-$6, simple math. One die, four quality plastic player peices, pretty quick play for a Monopoly game. This version is a good step to traditional Monopoly.
customer_reviews.author: Fanna Nicole Smith

customer_reviews.title: Grandaugher loves it
customer_reviews.text: This game is absolutely perfect. I spent a little more on this version because I DID NOT want scary or ugly characters for my granddaughter to look at. The animals are so cute. I believe cute is good for little kids.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: ... when i was a kid it was alot of fun i saw this and decided to get it for ...
customer_reviews.text: i remember playing monopoly jr when i was a kid it was alot of fun i saw this and decided to get it for my boys i feel like they really dumbed this game down theirs only ones and no houses or hotels because of that a game lasts like 20 minutes my kids really enjoy playing it but im not a huge fan
customer_reviews.author: christine88

customer_reviews.title: Easy for kids
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how well my grandkids would do with this game but they loved it. Even my granddaughter who was still learning to count and took some time to get the hang of moving her piece by the roll of the dice. She won almost every game and they both still like to play it 3 years later.
customer_reviews.author: linda leddy

customer_reviews.title: Good option for a quicker, easier game
customer_reviews.text: Lacks the strategy of typical Monopoly and I would have preferred they had included some more strategy. However, the game is short in length, the children love the amusement park theme and, in this version, they have to exchange/count different denominations ( denominations come in $1, 2, 3, 4, 5--more typical denominations would have been a better option for Monopoly and the children!). Once one person is out of money, the game ends. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Wallis

customer_reviews.title: Good!! Love it
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game and super simple for my 5 yr old.. everything is great except the currency is thin paper so can get damaged easily. But no complaints for the price and the simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail David

customer_reviews.title: Our family had fun and it was an easy enough game that our ...
customer_reviews.text: We just played it last night! Our family had fun and it was an easy enough game that our 5 year old felt like the King of Monopoly and not overwhelmed as he does when we play the regular game. I only wish that this Jr. game came with different values of money instead of just one dollar bills. Having the variety would make it more challenging and get the kids working on their math skills even more.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Family

customer_reviews.title: Fun version of monopoly for kids and whole family!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great game! It’s nice quality, looks great, has cute “character” pawns, and “chance” cards. We like this version of Monopoly because the whole family can play and have fun, it doesn’t take hours. My 5 year old, my 8 year old both can play and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: MamaWY10

customer_reviews.title: My kids love this game
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this game. It's easy and simple for early game players! Typically the game takes about 10- 15 minutes before it was over. But once we got stuck in a loop where we the bank almost went bankrupt and it took like 1- 1.5 hours to play. But again I think it was just one of those stale mate kind of situations.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany B.

customer_reviews.title: My kids' new favorite game
customer_reviews.text: I have two six-year-old boys. I'm so glad they've moved beyond Candy Land and Chutes & Ladders. This game is perfect. The only complaint I have is that the game pieces tip over easily (all except for the dog). We'll likely glue something onto the bottom of them for added support.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Kirsch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome family game
customer_reviews.text: My family loves monopoly junior. After a couple weeks we decided to move on to regular monopoly but I have to admit, sometimes I miss monopoly junior. My son is 6 and he had no trouble getting the hang of it. The games actually end in a reasonable amount of time, unlock regular monopoly.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Gruenler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Introduction to Monopoly for  young ones!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure about this when I bought it- grands 5,7 Love it! Learned it well after a couple of sessions! Absolutely perfect introduction to Monopoly!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: My son plays this 5 times a day! He loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old son loves board games. I bought a Monopoly Junior Board Game for him to learn counting money and investment. Well, he loves it so much that we play every single day multiple times a day. This now is his favorite game.
customer_reviews.author: Clara_NC

customer_reviews.title: 6 Year Old Niece Loved It
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas for my 6 year old niece. Not only did she soundly beat me several times, she forced everyone to play multiple games a day with her for a couple of weeks. We all had so much fun with it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great game for kids
customer_reviews.text: Great way to enjoy monopoly with kids too young to understand the standard game. Hardly any choices but makes you feel like you are in charge of the game and competing with something other than the luck of the roll.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FUN- quick - employs math skills - sons love it
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! I bought it for my 7-year old son, and he always wants to play it. I hate the original monopoly to be honest. This can be quick if you stop when one player runs out of money. However, you can also barter property which is great problem solving requiring the use of math. We put down Velcro strips and backing on the property pieces so one bump didn't ruin the game. My older teens enjoy it too.
customer_reviews.author: beachbriel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, quick monopoly for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: 4 and 6 year olds love this! I love that they pay attention the entire time and they don’t get bored! Much better than our attempt at real monopoly with the 6yo...
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: I was more excited than him.
customer_reviews.text: Oh yup we play this...we battle my grandson & I. It's on , I get him on Fridays not since the virus but it will happen again. & I'll get him again. Txs
customer_reviews.author: Chrissie

customer_reviews.title: Very fun - 7 and 5 year old love it
customer_reviews.text: I have two girls (7 and 5) that love this game. It's a great introduction to the adult version of Monopoly. This one has a rule that requires you to purchase a property if you land on it and it's unowned. We've even changed that rule and allow the players to make the choice and it still is a lot of fun for the kids. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: commish22

customer_reviews.title: Tolerable kids game
customer_reviews.text: This is a very tolerable children's game. It has a few different rules than the regular monopoly game but it's for kids after all! I feel this is much better than Candyland, chutes and ladders, or even Old Maid/Go Fish. The game does not take very long to play and sometimes our family plays two games within 30 or 40 minutes. The kids enjoy it and isn't that the point?!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Elementary kids will love this!
customer_reviews.text: It was a little too easy for my 7 year old, but she's pretty talented when it comes to strategy games. I totally recommend though!
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Family fun
customer_reviews.text: Great game for family fun. It is also a great beginning lesson for my kid about money. He gets the idea quick while enjoy playing!
customer_reviews.author: Yin

customer_reviews.title: Favorite family game
customer_reviews.text: We love playing this game as a family. This was the only game my 5 year old really wanted for Christmas and it did not disappoint. We have played several times and he still loves it! He likes to the banker and with it only having $1 instead of multiple denominations he is able to do this without help. My 4 year old got bored of it easily but is perfect for my competitive 5 year old!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Monopoly Jr is a great gift and fun to play. My 4 year old understood how to play and the amount of time playing the game was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: not worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: too easy for my grandson who was 6 when I purchased it. was no fun after playing few times, he is good at math we moved to regular monopoly not worth the $$ wait a yr buy reg one.
customer_reviews.author: dawgsmum

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for intro to board games for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: wasn't sure what to expect from monopoly jr but it's seriously great for my 4 year old. it's a very simplified version of monopoly and he absolutely loves it! he's able to follow the rules of the game just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Carolanne I

customer_reviews.title: My 4 year-old loves this game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is absolutely amazing! My 4 year-old son loves to play BANKER and is helping him understand the basics of buying, renting, and paying his way out of JAIL!!!! Great buy and gets the family together for old-fashioned electronic-free board game fun.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBrugs

customer_reviews.title: Fun loving game
customer_reviews.text: I am a die hard classic Monopoly player. Great family game. Got this for my cousin. This version is more simplified. It still requires counting skills. The only thing that I think would make the game better is if they had more than one denomination it would be better. Other than that its afun loving game.
customer_reviews.author: AmsUser

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all
customer_reviews.text: Great game and easy to play. My 4 year old loves it. Great for teaching money, basic counting, and other skills.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for small kids that find original monopoly hard
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my little one who loves to play the original Monopoly. This is a fast game, with only $1 bills.
customer_reviews.author: Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Very Juvenile
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with this game (pieces are all there, nice package, etc.). My only issue is that it is very juvenile. My five year old can play real Monopoly with a little help so I purchased this game so that we could play shorter games and he would be able to fully understand the rules. This game is so basic that it really wasn't worth the money that I spent.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy kid friendly game! My girls love it, I do wish it had more options or more money. But it’s cute and fun!
customer_reviews.author: M.Thurman

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner monopoly players
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginner monopoly players. I bought this for my 8 year old for a shorter game (she loves monopoly but let's be honest I don't have 5 hours to sit there with her and play). She was disappointed that it was SO short and that you only deal in $1 bills. So maybe for a 5/6 year old this would be good.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Really fun
customer_reviews.text: My kids 6, 5, 3 and 1 all like it. Of course me and the 1 year old are a team. But it is very simple and easy to understand for the other kids. Only downside is it may get slightly boring after the first few plays. Over all, great family game. I also recommend the picture charades game for kids, with no reading. We have spent many hours on that game. Worth a little more in my opinion :)
customer_reviews.author: mplalala

customer_reviews.title: Fun for young kids
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loves this game . Super easy and quick to learn . The game lasts just long enough to keep their attention .
customer_reviews.author: sarah hartford

customer_reviews.title: Great for young (and old) kids.
customer_reviews.text: We have 5 and 9 year olds boys. They love this game! Way better than the actual monopoly game (for this age group). Much simpler rules to follow. I even caught our babysitter playing the game with her sister--without our boys! LOL The main changes are that you have to buy properties you land on and there is only one currency unit: $1M. I guess that means monopoly dollars--but for fun we have been calling them $1million dollar bills. Makes the math easier so the kids can focus on the fun.
customer_reviews.author: locomoco

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for the kids and I
customer_reviews.text: My 5 and 7 year olds love playing this with me and anyone else that is over at the house. It is simple enough they can play it together without an adult and it teaches them a little about counting, simple multiplication, and money and all the while they're having fun doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great for 7 and 3 years!
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it. I thought my 3 year old won't understand but I was wrong! We played it for hours! Together!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha C

customer_reviews.title: Younger kids only
customer_reviews.text: My kids didn’t seem interested in the rules and they are 4 and 8 so we just play regular monopoly now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Take a look at this one!
customer_reviews.text: Looked at many junior versions of time-honored board games and picked this one because it was the one closest to the "real" game. It has jail/just visiting and great kid-focused properties but easier money-tending. It certainly beats the tedium of chutes and ladders-type games any day. The transition to "big Monopoly" also will be easier since many of the basics will be familiar.
customer_reviews.author: cranny

customer_reviews.title: Great for younger players!
customer_reviews.text: This is a simplified version of the Monopoly game that can have a winner before my 6 year old grandson loses interest. The game’s a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

product_meta.title: Monopoly Junior Board Game
product_meta.description:
Welcome to the first Monopoly game for kids, where they can earn money the fun way! The Monopoly Junior game is just like the classic Monopoly game, but it's accessible and exciting for younger players. It's fast, simple, and full of surprises. Kids choose their favorite Junior token and learn how to pass Go, buy properties, and collect rent. Single banknotes keep the transactions fast and easy.

The Hasbro Gaming and Monopoly names and logos, the distinctive design of the gameboard, the four corner squares, the Mr. Monopoly name and character, as well as each of the distinctive elements of the board and playing pieces are trademarks of Hasbro for its property trading game and game equipment.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Hasbro is committed to being an ethical and responsible company and is a recognized toy industry leader in the areas of product safety, environmental sustainability, ethical sourcing and philanthropy.

See more
feature_bullets: My First Monopoly Game: the classic game for younger players
Adorable Junior Tokens: play with classic tokens before they grew up
Fun, Kid-Friendly Properties: buy cool properties such as the pet store, the candy store, and the video game arcade
Fast, Fun, and Simple to Play: easy rules use single dollar bills for simple transactions
Includes: Gameboard, 4 tokens, 20 chance cards, 48 sold signs, 90 banknotes, 4 character cards, and 1 die
Fast-trading Monopoly Junior game is for younger players
Game is like the classic Monopoly game but easier for kids
Properties are fun places like an ice cream parlor and a skate park
Single banknotes keep the transactions quick and easy
Includes gameboard, 4 tokens, 20 Chance cards, 48 Sold signs, 90 x M1 banknotes, 4 Whos Your Token character cards, and 1 die
